value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">every life, complete, <del>beat</del> <del>beating behind</del> And the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mounting image, the wind & [illeg.], still blow out</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the speech, even in the printed book.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>There is</del> <del>The</del> It is crude. The poet is anonymous.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>This</del> <del>And yet what a</del> All is now spoken by</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">each actor. There are no abstractions.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>All is realised:</del> the pomp & the masks & the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">great swollen figures; <del>as if</del> Nothing is left</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">lurking in the shades. <del>Still</del> <del>Even</del> The figures are</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">palpable, coloured, strident. Is it</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">something has set in motion, not knights & ladies,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but the crude, jagged outlines of real</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">men. [And for?] there is a bombast & a splendour,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the great painted wigs & their [illeg.] [logs?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are <del>as</del> still damp, un carved. Laughter,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">like great moths brought by the [illeg.]:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>But</del> It is momentuous, [naked?]; resonant:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And the great names clash like brass.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Resound <del>& [comedy?]</del> No one is delicately</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">depicted. There is no shadow: but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">all is gold & purple. And yet</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the [currency?], the trumpets, fill the words: the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[abeard?], the <choice>
            <sic>huperbole</sic>
            <corr>hyperbole</corr>
          </choice>: this is a mood, a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">splendid rhapsody: <del>filled</del> blown like a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with [folio?], in their [hur?], in suffering; but</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">yet – <del>for there is no quarter, no stalling;</del></l>

<del xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <l>suddenly, in the stress of emotion; a</l>
            <l>another & yet, for all its stridency, its</l>
          </del>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pomp, all the height of splendour, how</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the poet can cut a gash in the fabric:</l>

<quote xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" source="#" rend="block">
            <l>So poets say, my Lord</l>
            <l>And tis a pretty thing to be a poet</l>
          </quote>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Could he stop, he would suffer. But there is no</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[poem?], no shade as he travels. The [assess?]</l>
